stages.title: Stage 1 – Units Setup & Cabling
stages.description: Pre-measurement checks and recording of site metadata before any instrument setup.
issues: High wind or direct sun can cause instability — use shelter/shade where possible.
Nearby vibration sources such as traffic, trains, or machinery will affect measurements.
Baseline sites should be away from fluctuating water sources.

steps.action: Unpack Lower Unit (IB) (Interferometer Base); Place in position North Aligned
steps.expected: Unit centered over mark or tripod, stable footing, Connector to North

steps.action: Unpack Upper Unit (DU) (Dropper Unit); Place *Near* position
steps.expected: Place near location, KEEP BATTERY CONNECTED

steps.action: Connect *yellow* Aviation cable to IB and Main Panel
steps.expected: All connectors secure, correct ports used, 1x Aviation Connector connected, no red connector circle

steps.action: Connect 2xBNC cables to IB and Main Panel
steps.expected: Lower Unit cables properly attached, 2x BNC

steps.action: Connect *black* Aviation cables to DU and Main Panel
steps.expected: All connectors secure, correct ports used, 1x Aviation Connector connected, no red connector circle

steps.action: Check on Main Panel ION POWER Led
steps.expected: ION POWER lever Down, Led is ON
Ion pump OFF, max time off battery is 10-15 min
PC operator can Prep Site Project

steps.action: Unpack Osciloscope + Cables; Unpack Multimeter + Cables
steps.expected: 2 BNC Cables (short); 1 BNC cable (long); 1 Temp Probe

stages.title: Stage 2 - Power Up & Temperature Warm-up
stages.description: Initial power-up of the A-10 system, enabling subsystems and allowing warm-up before optical alignment and measurement.
issues: Incorrect polarity or loose connections can damage electronics or cause unstable operation.
Insufficient warm-up time can result in unstable fringes and drifting measurements.
Avoid powering the ion pump if the vacuum is compromised — check vacuum health first.
refs: A-10 Manual - Power Supply and Connections

steps.expected: Electronics rack fans and indicators active

steps.action: Connect multimeter to ION CUR terminal, set to VDC, read value; WAIT
steps.expected: 0.2–0.5 VDC, wait for good value, *redo vacuum if issue*

steps.action: Connect multimeter to IB TEMP terminal, set to VDC, read value; WAIT
steps.expected: Equivalent to 5–10 °C above ambient; wait 1–4 h

stages.title: Stage 3 - Lower Unit (IB) Calibration & Leveling
stages.description: Position and prepare the Interferometer Base (Lower Unit) over the survey mark, level the system, and verify optical alignment readiness.
issues: Lower Unit is heavy and delicate — handle with care during removal from the case.
Surface instability can cause leveling drift; ensure solid footing before proceeding.
Do not disengage Superspring travel lock until instructed in a later stage.
refs: A-10 Manual - Setting Up The Lower Unit

steps.action: Set/Check interferometer button UP to calibrate Lower Unit (IB)
steps.expected: Interferometer in calibration position; IB in Up/Atatched position

steps.action: Press AUTO LEVEL on Main Panel; WAIT
steps.expected: Bubble levels centered automatically; Wait for Noise Reduction

steps.action: Remove plug from Lower Unit (IB) beam aperture
Opticaly Align fringes with Vertical Beam Checker (VBC)
steps.expected: Laser dots aligned; attention to VBC placement Marks

steps.action: Measure setup height (if needed or tripod in use)
steps.expected: From survey mark to IB base plate (cm)

stages.title: Stage 4 - Upper Unit Mounting & Decoupling *Critical Step*
stages.description: Mount the Upper Unit (Dropping Chamber) on the Lower Unit, secure it, disengage travel locks, and separate the units to prevent vibration transfer.
issues: Laser beam hazard — avoid direct eye exposure when removing the beam cover.
Ensure Upper Unit feet are stable and vertical to prevent misalignment.
Do not skip the separation step — vibrations from the dropper will affect measurements if units remain coupled.
refs: A-10 Manual - Setting the Upper Unit (Dropping Chamber)

steps.action: Place Upper Unit on Lower Unit (IB); lower Upper Unit feet
steps.expected: Feet vertical and stable; *CHECK LASER PLUG IS REMOVED*
Lower and Upper Unit physically separated

steps.action: Unlock Lower Unit (IB) (release Superspring travel lock)

steps.expected: Small visible gaps between v-groove and DU ball

stages.title: Stage 5 - Fringe Check *Critical Step*
stages.description: Use the dropper controller to oscillate the cart, check and optimize fringe contrast, and verify optical stability before starting measurements.
issues: Fringe amplitude too low – check optical alignment and clean optics
No fringe signal – verify oscilloscope connection and laser status
Unstable fringes – check temperature control and avoid air currents
Cart not moving in OSC mode – verify travel lock disengaged
refs: A-10 Manual Section 3: Dropping Chamber Controller Set Up
A-10 Manual Section 5: Aligning Interferometer and Superspring

steps.action: Connect oscilloscope to ANALOG FRINGE output
Set MODE to OSC and press RESET
Measure fringe amplitude on oscilloscope;  *Redo Stage 4 if low*
Rotate MODE knob to DROP and press RESET
steps.expected: Drop mode selected; ready for manual/auto drop

stages.title: Stage 6 - Software & Test Measurement
issues: Do not disengage travel lock before switching to MANUAL
Large zero offset may indicate tripod mislevel or mechanical obstruction
